citations.narrative:
The male cougar has a small water point (Approx. 8ft diameter x 4in deep) that was full of water that was green in color
with a large amount of floating algal pads and clumps covering the majority of the surface of the water. While there was a
bucket of clean water for drinking available on other side of the enclosure, the water source with the accumulation of
algae is available for the animal to drink and is within a few feet of where the cougar lays down much of the time. The staff
advised that water point remains dry most of the time, however due to rains it had filled up and failed to be cleaned out.
Water sources that are not cleaned often enough can be a source of possible health issues if there is an overgrowth of
algae or other water contamination, including mosquito breeding areas in areas of stagnant shallow water areas.
All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. The facility needs to increase their cleaning protocols/processes for
the water pool in the cougar enclosure.
To be corrected by: The water point had been cleaned by the delivery of this inspection report and was corrected.

The pool area (Approx. 65ft x 25ft x 3.5ft) that is available for 10 African penguins was very dark green with algae to the
point where the penguins could not be seen when under the surface of the water. Due to the high temperatures and lack
of shade the algae multiplied very quickly, and the complete water change in the pool appears to have been delayed up to
one extra week. The staff advised that normal cleaning is 'about every week however this pool was not cleaned for two
weeks'.
The lack of timely cleaning of pools where penguins swim can lead to possible health issues with increased poor water
quality and increase in algae or other water contaminants.
The facility needs to adjust their complete pool cleaning procedures and processes for increased temperatures and sun
exposure that can lead to increased production of algal growth in a short period of time.
To be corrected by: The pool was deep cleaned by the delivery of this inspection report and has been corrected.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The male cougar has a small water point (Approx. 8ft diameter x 4in deep) that was full of water that was green in color 
with a large amount of floating algal pads and clumps covering the majority of the surface of the water. While there was a 
bucket of clean water for drinking available on other side of the enclosure, the water source with the accumulation of 
algae is available for the animal to drink and is within a few feet of where the cougar lays down much of the time. The staff 
advised that water point remains dry most of the time, however due to rains it had filled up and failed to be cleaned out. 
 
Water sources that are not cleaned often enough can be a source of possible health issues if there is an overgrowth of 
algae or other water contamination, including mosquito breeding areas in areas of stagnant shallow water areas.  
 
All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. The facility needs to increase their cleaning protocols/processes for 
the water pool in the cougar enclosure. 
 
To be corrected by: The water point had been cleaned by the delivery of this inspection report and was corrected. 
3.157(a)(2) 
   
Water quality. 
The pool area (Approx. 65ft x 25ft x 3.5ft) that is available for 10 African penguins was very dark green with algae to the 
point where the penguins could not be seen when under the surface of the water. Due to the high temperatures and lack 
of shade the algae multiplied very quickly, and the complete water change in the pool appears to have been delayed up to 
one extra week. The staff advised that normal cleaning is 'about every week however this pool was not cleaned for two 
weeks'. 
 
The lack of timely cleaning of pools where penguins swim can lead to possible health issues with increased poor water 
quality and increase in algae or other water contaminants. 
 
The facility needs to adjust their complete pool cleaning procedures and processes for increased temperatures and sun 
exposure that can lead to increased production of algal growth in a short period of time.

To be corrected by: The pool was deep cleaned by the delivery of this inspection report and has been corrected. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: AFRICAN HUNTING DOG / AFRICAN WILD DOG
SILVERY LUTUNG / SILVERED LANGUR / LEAF MONKEY
